alert.note: Alert for Deltana and Tanana Flats; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 09 at 6:39AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Snow This Afternoon And Tonight... Rain is developing this morning, and will mix with snow by this afternoon, and change to all snow by early this evening. In locations above 2000 feet rain will change to all snow bu this afternoon. Between 2 and 4 inches of snow is expected above 2000 ft through tonight, with an inch of so at valley level. Areas of the Alaska Range could see 6 or more inches of snow above 3000 ft. West winds of 15 mph gusting to 30 mph are expected to develop this afternoon and continue into early Monday morning. This will cause blowing snow with reduced visibility over highway summits this afternoon into tonight.

area.areaDesc: Deltana and Tanana Flats; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
